verses.verse: A Song <WH7892> or Psalm <WH4210> of Asaph. <WH623> Keep not you silence, <WH1824> O God: <WH430> hold <WH2790> not your peace, <WH2790> and be not still, <WH8252> O God. <WH410>
For, see, <WH2009> your enemies <WH341> make a tumult: <WH1993> and they that hate <WH8130> you have lifted <WH5375> up the head. <WH7218>
They have taken crafty <WH6191> counsel <WH5475> against <WH5921> your people, <WH5971> and consulted <WH3289> against <WH5921> your hidden <WH6845> ones.

They have said, <WH559> Come, <WH3212> and let us cut <WH3582> them off from being a nation; <WH1471> that the name <WH8034> of Israel <WH3478> may be no <WH3808> more <WH5750> in remembrance. <WH2142>
For they have consulted <WH3289> together <WH3162> with one consent: <WH3820> they are confederate <WH1285> <WH3772> against <WH5921> you:
The tabernacles <WH168> of Edom, <WH123> and the Ishmaelites; <WH3459> of Moab, <WH4124> and the Hagarenes; <WH1905>
Gebal, <WH1381> and Ammon, <WH5983> and Amalek; <WH6002> the Philistines <WH6430> with the inhabitants <WH3427> of Tyre; <WH6865>
Assur <WH804> also <WH1571> is joined <WH3867> with them: they have helped <WH2220> the children <WH1121> of Lot. <WH3876> Selah. <WH5542>
Do <WH6213> to them as to the Midianites; <WH4080> as to Sisera, <WH5516> as to Jabin, <WH2985> at the brook <WH5158> of Kison: <WH7028>
Which perished <WH8045> at Endor: <WH5874> they became <WH1961> as dung <WH1828> for the earth. <WH127>
Make <WH7896> their nobles <WH5081> like Oreb, <WH6157> and like Zeeb: <WH2062> yes, all <WH3605> their princes <WH5257> as Zebah, <WH2078> and as Zalmunna: <WH6759>
Who <WH834> said, <WH559> Let us take to ourselves the houses <WH4999> of God <WH430> in possession. <WH3423>
O my God, <WH430> make <WH7896> them like a wheel; <WH1534> as the stubble <WH7179> before <WH6440> the wind. <WH7307>
As the fire <WH784> burns <WH1197> a wood, <WH3293> and as the flame <WH3852> sets <WH3857> the mountains <WH2022> on fire; <WH3857>
So <WH3651> persecute <WH7291> them with your tempest, <WH5591> and make them afraid <WH926> with your storm. <WH5492>
Fill <WH4390> their faces <WH6440> with shame; <WH7036> that they may seek <WH1245> your name, <WH8034> O LORD. <WH3068>
Let them be confounded <WH954> and troubled <WH926> for ever; <WH5703> yes, let them be put to shame, <WH2659> and perish: <WH6>
That men may know <WH3045> that you, whose name <WH8034> alone <WH905> is JEHOVAH, <WH3068> are the most <WH5945> high <WH5945> over <WH5921> all <WH3605> the earth. <WH776>
